com.github.koraktor.mavanagaiata
Class AbstractGitMojo

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.maven.plugin.AbstractMojo
      com.github.koraktor.mavanagaiata.AbstractGitMojo
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.apache.maven.plugin.ContextEnabled, org.apache.maven.plugin.Mojo
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractGitOutputMojo, GitBranchMojo, GitCommitMojo, GitTagMojo
public abstract class AbstractGitMojo
extends org.apache.maven.plugin.AbstractMojo

This abstract Mojo implements initializing a JGit Repository and provides this Repository instance to subclasses.

Since:
0.1.0
Author:
Sebastian Staudt
See Also:
Repository

          The date format to use for various dates

          The flag to append to refs if there are changes in the index or working tree

          The GIT_DIR path of the Git repository

          The commit or ref to use as starting point for operations

          The Maven project

          The prefixes to prepend to property keys
protected  org.eclipse.jgit.lib.Repository repository

execute

public final void execute()
                   throws org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException
Generic execution sequence for a Mavanagaiata mojo

Will initialize any needed resources, run the actual mojo code and cleanup afterwards.

org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException
See Also:
cleanup(), init(), run()

addProperty

protected void addProperty(String name,
                           String value)
Saves a property with the given name into the project's properties The value will be stored two times – with "mavanagaiata" and "mvngit" as a prefix.

Parameters:
name - The property name
value - The value of the property

cleanup

protected void cleanup()
Closes the JGit repository object

See Also:
Repository.close()

init

protected void init()
             throws org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException
Generic initialization for all Mavanagaiata mojos

This will initialize the JGit repository instance for further usage by the mojo.

Throws:
org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException - if the repository cannot be initialized

initRepository

protected void initRepository()
                       throws IOException,
                              org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException
Initializes a JGit Repository object for further reference

Throws:
IOException - if retrieving information from the Git repository fails
org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException
See Also:
Repository

isDirty

protected boolean isDirty()
                   throws IOException,
                          org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException
Returns whether either the working tree or the index of the repository is dirty

Returns:
true if the repository contains changes
Throws:
IOException - if the diff could not be built
org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException

protected org.eclipse.jgit.revwalk.RevCommit getHead()
                                              throws IOException,
                                                     org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException
Returns a commit object for the repository's current HEAD

Returns:
The commit object of the repository's current HEAD
Throws:
IOException - if the repository HEAD could not be retrieved
org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException
